name: Barbell Shoulder Press
how_to_perform:
1. Stand or sit with your back straight and engage your core by drawing your belly button towards your spine.

2. Hold a barbell across your upper chest, with your hands shoulder-width apart and an overhand grip on the bar. Your arms should hang relaxed underneath the bar.

3. If you are standing, keep your feet shoulder-width apart, with one foot slightly back for stability.

4. To begin the movement, lift the barbell off the rack to just above your shoulders, keeping it at a slight angle from side to side and directly over your chest.

5. Press upwards, extending your arms fully so that the barbell is locked in place with your palms facing forward.

6. Pause for a brief moment at the top of the movement, squeezing your shoulder muscles by drawing them up towards your ears.

7. Slowly lower the barbell back to the starting position, keeping control throughout the entire range of motion.

8. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: The barbell shoulder press is an upper body strength training exercise used to target the shoulders and triceps that utilizes dumbbells or a weighted barbell.
